intro: Hibbertia stricta f. rosmarinifolia, commonly known as the silver-leafed hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves with a silvery-green hue due to dense pubescence. Its showy, yellow-orange flowers are typically borne in clusters at the ends of the branches. Hibbertia stricta f. rosmarinifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to well-drained, sandy soils.
